attribs.current: @{Patrol-Class Security Robot|whisper_state}&{template:sf_generic} {{name=@{character_name}}} {{characterid=@{character_id}}} {{title=^{pilot}}} {{r1=[[1d20+@{|piloting_ranks}[RNK]+[[({0,@{|piloting_ranks}}>1) * @{|piloting_class_skill}]][CS]+@{|piloting_ability}[ABI]+2-2@{|piloting_misc}@{Patrol-Class Security Robot|engines_status}@{Patrol-Class Security Robot|power_core_status}@{Patrol-Class Security Robot|computer_query}?{HELM PHASE INITIATIVE|NO, |YES,&{tracker}}]]}} {{r1name=}}

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-LvIxcXR1KDoS-aOim2t_description
attribs.current: Arc emitters discharge a cone of electrical energy that can damage and stun anyone within its area. Advanced arc emitters can be used at a longer range and are used by military forces to stun and subdue groups of enemies.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-LvIyASssF0wcl5pMExZ_description
attribs.current: Once every 1d4 rounds as a standard action, a patrol-class security robot can shoot an arc of electricity at up to four creatures within 40 feet (no two of which can be more than 30 feet apart). This arc deals 1d8 electricity damage to each target (Reflex DC 13 half).

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Tactical Arc Emitter with 2 Batteries (20 Charges each)

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-LvIzeW8AXdnQapNh2tW_description
attribs.current: A patrol-class security robot’s nanites heal it, restoring a number of Hit Points per hour equal to its CR (4 Hit Points per hour for most security robots). Once per day as a full action, a patrol-class security robot can restore 3d8 Hit Points to itself or any touched construct with the technological subtype.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-LvIzeW8AXdnQapNh2tW_target
attribs.current: Self or Touched construct with the Technological Subtype

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-LvIzSIZ9Ku5kX3Dv5ol_description
attribs.current: A security robot’s weapons are integrated into its frame and can’t be disarmed.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The afflicted employees attack the PCs with random pieces of office furniture (such as chairs and hefty personal items), which function as tactical batons. They don’t chase PCs who leave this room.

Morale If provoked and not allowed to return to their computers, the employees fight to the death.

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Piece of Office Furniture (Functions as Tactical Baton), Engineering Tool Kit, Professional Clothing, White Eclipse Key Card; Augmentations: Productivity Implant

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
Before Combat The terminator-class security robot uses Stealth to attempt to ambush intruders.

During Combat The terminator-class security robot shoots targets with its plasma rifle until a PC closes the gap to enter melee; if the robot is reduced to 60 Hit Points or fewer and has not yet been engaged in melee, it charges its enemies. When reduced to 40 Hit Points or fewer, the terminator-class security robot activates its nanite repair ability. On the next round, it activates its hardware acceleration ability and continues attacking.

Morale The security robot fights until it is destroyed.

attribs.name: weaknesses
attribs.current: Vulnerable to Critical Hits, Vulnerable to Electricity

attribs.name: pilot_bonus
attribs.current: @{Terminator-Class Security Robot|whisper_state}&{template:sf_generic} {{name=@{character_name}}} {{characterid=@{character_id}}} {{title=^{pilot}}} {{r1=[[1d20+@{|piloting_ranks}[RNK]+[[({0,@{|piloting_ranks}}>1) * @{|piloting_class_skill}]][CS]+@{|piloting_ability}[ABI]+2-2@{|piloting_misc}@{Terminator-Class Security Robot|engines_status}@{Terminator-Class Security Robot|power_core_status}@{Terminator-Class Security Robot|computer_query}?{HELM PHASE INITIATIVE|NO, |YES,&{tracker}}]]}} {{r1name=}}

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Integrated Yellow Star Plasma Rifle with 1 High-Capacity Battery (40 Charges)

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWKK1EKEYCQl0pCHqM0_description
attribs.current: Once per day as a swift action, a terminator-class security robot can over-clock its processors to gain greater speed than other security robot models for a number of rounds equal to half its CR (5 rounds for most terminator-class security robots). This extra speed has several benefits: When making a full attack, the robot can also take a separate move action in order to move. This movement can occur before, after, or between the attacks from the full attack, but all movement must occur at the same time. In addition, the robot’s land speed increases to 70 feet. This ability functions as a haste effect.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWKKYXAhSyrRFCaSG0d_description
attribs.current: A terminator-class security robot’s nanites heal it, restoring a number of Hit Points per hour equal to its CR (10 Hit Points per hour for most terminator-class security robots). Once per day as a full action, a terminator-class security robot can restore [[5d8]] Hit Points to itself or any touched construct with the technological subtype.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWKJsshoO3h3zBRG6Qk_description
attribs.current:
Plasma rifles fire long lines of ionized plasma that lance through objects and opponents in their path.

Plasma Weapons
Superheated or electromagnetically charged gas becomes ionized plasma, which plasma weapons emit in a controlled blast. Ionized plasma deals both electricity and fire damage, tearing through organic flesh and metal alike. Plasma beams can be projected, as from a gun, or maintained in a steady beam with a powerful magnetic field, as the blade of a melee weapon.

Followers of Sarenrae popularized terms for the different intensities of plasma swords based on the heat they emit. The hottest, deadliest plasma weapon is a blue star, followed in descending order by white star, yellow star, red star, and finally tactical plasma weapons.

attribs.name: race
attribs.current: Male and Female Verthani Cybernetic Zombie

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWFWcOcTRZMszPODFKJ_description
attribs.current: The laser pistol is possibly the most common small arm used by explorers, guards, mercenaries, and traders. Laser pistols are light and reliable, yet they still deal a respectable amount of damage.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
A10. Medical Research Lab
During Combat The reanimated employees attack with their corona laser pistols and then charge the PCs.

Morale These mindless undead fight until they are destroyed.

A13. Master Computer Room
During Combat These undead attempt to maintain a bit of distance between themselves and the PCs, firing their corona laser pistols.

Morale The reanimated employees fight until they are destroyed.

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Corona Laser Pistol with 1 Battery (20 Charges)

attribs.name: save_notes
attribs.current: +2 vs. Disease, Mind-Affecting Effects, Poison, and Sleep

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
Before Combat If combat seems unavoidable, Noname uses her spell ampoule of invisibility. During Combat If cornered, Noname shoots with her laser pistol in self-defence and looks to escape.

Morale Noname is not a skilled fighter. If she doesn’t escape, she surrenders once reduced to 50 Hit Points or fewer.

attribs.name: other_abilities
attribs.current: Artificial Intelligence (Drone Named Ghost), Constructed, Expert Rig (Datajack), Flat Effect, Mechanic Tricks (Ghost Intrusion, Hack Directory), Miracle Worker (2/Day), Remote Hack (DC 18), Upgrade Slot (Mk 2 Electrostatic Field)

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Gold AbadarCorp Travel Suit, Aphelion Laser Pistol with 1 High-Capacity Battery (40 Charges), Incapacitator with 1 Battery (20 Charges), Spell Ampoule of Invisibility, Engineering Kit, Hacking Kit; Augmentations: High-Density Datajack

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWFZJIzMJWfmfznOvWe_description
attribs.current: When this nonreflective, dark-gray baton connects with a target, it discharges an electrical pulse that can stagger its victim.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWFZTDvwsikFMkgZ9ze_description
attribs.current: The laser pistol is possibly the most common small arm used by explorers, guards, mercenaries, and traders. Laser pistols are light and reliable, yet they still deal a respectable amount of damage.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWFZagfnukV6zV9Hurc_description
attribs.current: Noname's overload class feature now affects androids, drones, robots, and creatures with the technological subtype, which must succeed at a Will saving throw (DC = 18) or be dazed for 1 round. If the target fails its saving throw by 10 or more, it is not dazed and you can dictate its actions for 1 round, though these actions can’t be obviously self-destructive. Once a creature has attempted a saving throw against this attack (regardless of the result), it is immune to this attack for 24 hours.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWFZagfnukV6zV9Hurc_effect
attribs.current: Dazed. If fail by 10 or more, Noname can dictate its actions for 1 Round.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWFZagfnukV6zV9Hurc_target
attribs.current: One Creature with the Technological Subtype or One Technological Device

attribs.name: other_abilities
attribs.current: Mods (Hardened AI, Invisibility Field, Reactive Camouflage), Reduced Actions, Unliving

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Corona Laser Pistol with 2 Batteries (20 Charges)

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWFbDZQK1PzejNz4odP_description
attribs.current:
The laser pistol is possibly the most common small arm used by explorers, guards, mercenaries, and traders. Laser pistols are light and reliable, yet they still deal a respectable amount of damage.

Laser Weapons
Laser weapons emit highly focused beams of light that deal fire damage. These beams can pass through glass and other transparent physical barriers, dealing damage to such barriers as they pass through. Barriers of energy or magical force block lasers. Invisible creatures don’t take damage from lasers, as the beams pass through them harmlessly. Fog, smoke, and other clouds provide both cover and concealment from laser attacks. Lasers can penetrate darkness, but they don’t provide any illumination.

Laser weapons use various means to concentrate beams of light into deadly intensity. Some focus light through a faceted crystal, while others focus the beam through a chemical cloud or ionized gas.

attribs.name: pilot_bonus
attribs.current: @{Contracted Merc|whisper_state}&{template:sf_generic} {{name=@{character_name}}} {{characterid=@{character_id}}} {{title=^{pilot}}} {{r1=[[1d20+@{|piloting_ranks}[RNK]+[[({0,@{|piloting_ranks}}>1) * @{|piloting_class_skill}]][CS]+@{|piloting_ability}[ABI]+2-2@{|piloting_misc}@{Contracted Merc|engines_status}@{Contracted Merc|power_core_status}@{Contracted Merc|computer_query}?{HELM PHASE INITIATIVE|NO, |YES,&{tracker}}]]}} {{r1name=}}

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Veesk Overplate I, Advanced Rail Gun with 30 Longarm Rounds, Tactical Skyfire Sword with 2 Batteries (20 Charges each), Mk 2 Incendiary Grenades (2), Credstick (150 Credits); Augmentations: Wide-Spectrum Ocular Implants

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
Event 3: Alley Ambush
During Combat The contracted mercs throw their incendiary grenades at the PCs and then move into melee combat. They use Quick Draw to switch between weapons seamlessly, while staying mobile with nimble fusillade.

Morale The contracted mercs fight to the death unless given orders to retreat.

C1. Mean Streets of Cuvacara
During Combat The contracted mercs open fire with their rifles and then close into melee combat, being careful not to provide cover for the PCs against the attacks of the hired killers. They also try to keep the PCs away from the sniping positions the hired killers have taken.
Morale The contracted mercs fight to the death unless given orders to retreat.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWFcD-JocWYKmPle4XJ_description
attribs.current: Originally, these swords were known by their manufacturing ID, BSB–1750. Their popularity with the Skyfire Legion led to their colloquial name, Skyfire swords. Vents for burning gas jets line one edge of the hollow blade. When powered, magnetic fields contain and ignite the gases into a glowing corona of flames.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWFcJM1vMuBSZILGJ4e_description
attribs.current: Similar in design to the magnetar rifle, a rail gun uses magnetic fields to accelerate its rounds to lethal speeds. While magnetar rifles are more powerful, they’re also larger and heavier, leaving many to favor the smaller and lighter rail gun. The weapons’ affordability makes them a popular choice for members of the Starfinder Society and other exploratory groups. Rail guns come in tactical and advanced models, with the advanced rail gun being slightly larger.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWFcOYGFhLNBnS7FGY2_description
attribs.current:
Incendiary grenades detonate in a spray of superheated plasma.

Explode (2d6 F; Burning 1d6; 10 ft.)
Explosives have the Explode special property, which lists the amount of damage the explosion deals, the damage type, special effects (with a duration, if necessary), and the radius of the explosion. When a contracted merc with this type of weapon or Ammunition, aim at a grid intersection. Each Creature within the blast radius takes the listed damage but can attempt a Reflex saving throw for half damage. If the contracted merc scores a critical hit, it applies only to the Creature closest to the targeted intersection (they chooses the Creature if several are equally close). If the Explode special property has any special effects other than damage, they are negated with a successful saving throw. Some exploding Weapons, such as smoke Grenades, don't deal damage, so they don't include the damage and damage type entries.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWFd9NsTcZ9F94oWPWn_description
attribs.current: The hit-and-run fighting style focuses on tactical movement as the Contracted Merc moves in and out of combat. They use ranged weapons but fight close up, and they can even mix ranged and melee attacks. Their abilities allow them to move even when they make full attacks and to avoid getting locked down by their enemies.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWFdDhhvFZDT3dGvZ9p_description
attribs.current: When the Contracted Merc makes a full attack, they can also either take a guarded step or move up to half their speed. This movement can come before, between, or after their attacks, but it can’t be split up.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWFdFyZkQeoXNxI63Zg_description
attribs.current: The Contracted Merc gains Opening Volley as a bonus feat. If they already have this feat, choose a bonus combat feat instead. At 9th level, they can use Opening Volley on both their first and second turns in combat.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
Before Combat The hired killers activate their cloaking fields to observe the PCs and get into sniping positions.

During Combat Each hired killer attempts a debilitating trick attack and activates the entangling fusion of her sniper rifle with her first shot. If her sniping position is compromised, she attacks with her corona laser pistol.

Morale If reduced to 15 HP or fewer, a hired killer attempts to flee the area. She waits until she’s a safe distance away and then uses her comm unit to tell her allies to retreat.

attribs.name: other_abilities
attribs.current: Easily Augmented, Operative Exploits (Cloaking Field, Debilitating Sniper), Skin Mimic, Specialization (Ghost)

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Freebooter Armour II, Entangling Tactical Shirren-Eye Rifle with 25 Sniper Rounds, Corona Laser Pistol with 2 Batteries (20 Charges each), Mk 2 Serum of Healing, Medpatches (2), Credstick (400 credits)

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWFfG2z5qXfmiNAfPVb_description
attribs.current: These light blades can be used for both mundane tasks and combat. Tactical knives have large, double-edged blades, often with a section of serrated blade near the haft, and they come in both fixed- and folding-blade designs; users may prefer one style or the other.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWFfKYaobq8m5eVXNkD_description
attribs.current: The laser pistol is possibly the most common small arm used by explorers, guards, mercenaries, and traders. Laser pistols are light and reliable, yet they still deal a respectable amount of damage.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWFfOvWB8B7zwtjmZKD_description
attribs.current:
Shirren-eye rifles are named for their compound sights, which resemble the eyes of the insectile race, but are rarely manufactured by shirren companies. Shirren-eye rifles are extremely accurate and favoured by snipers and sharpshooters.

Entangle
A weapon with the entangling fusion gains the entangle weapon special property (see page 181). Only a single attack each day may benefit from this property, and you must announce before making an attack that it is an entangle attack. Regardless of how many targets you can hit with a single attack from your weapon, only a single target of your choice is affected by the entangle condition. The entangle effect ends after [[1d4]] rounds if the target has not already escaped it. Only weapons that do bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, or cold damage can benefit from this fusion.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWFfUrEaJBs0nmNr3So_description
attribs.current: When you succeed at both the skill check and attack roll of your trick attack, you can make the target flat-footed or off-target until the beginning of your next turn. You might learn exploits that grant you additional options for your debilitating trick, but you can select only one option each time you hit with a trick attack.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWFfXqjebo3cut1VXd-_description
attribs.current: You can trick or startle a foe and then attack when she drops her guard. As a full action, you can move up to your speed. Whether or not you moved, you can then make an attack with a melee weapon with the operative special property or with any small arm. Just before making your attack, attempt a Bluff, Intimidate, or Stealth check (or a check associated with your specialization; see page 94) with a DC equal to 20 + your target’s CR. If you succeed at the check, you deal 1d4 additional damage and the target is flat-footed against your attack. This damage increases to 1d8 at 3rd level, to 3d8 at 5th level, and by an additional 1d8 every 2 levels thereafter. You can’t use this ability with a weapon that has the unwieldy special property or that requires a full action to make a single attack.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
Before Combat If the PCs act hostile toward him, Scuttle orders his bodyguards to attack.

During Combat Scuttle uses improved get ‘em to direct his hired muscle to attack the strongest-looking PC. If a PC levels a dangerous-looking attack against one of his bodyguards, he warns them with watch out.

Morale If his vesk guards are reduced to 0 HP, or if he is reduced to 40 HP or fewer, Scuttle drops his weapon and begs for mercy.

attribs.name: other_abilities
attribs.current: Cheek Pouches, Envoy Inspirations (Get 'Em, Improved Get 'Em, Watch Out), Moxie

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Extex Suit III, Tactical Knife, Red Star Plasma Pistol with 2 Batteries (20 Charges each), Credstick (300 Credits); Augmentations: Storage Prosthetic Limb (Leg)

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWJEJKrbOsNi1RgOxog_description
attribs.current: These light blades can be used for both mundane tasks and combat. Tactical knives have large, double-edged blades, often with a section of serrated blade near the haft, and they come in both fixed- and folding-blade designs; users may prefer one style or the other.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWJEPm3B4wbUj9YQSyZ_description
attribs.current: Plasma pistols fire a line of ionized plasma out to a relatively short range. The plasma can continue to burn after contact.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
C2. Storefront
During Combat The vesk attack with their doshkos and try to get between Scuttle and the PCs, though one tries to stay adjacent to the ysoki. If the PCs attack Scuttle, the vesk adjacent to him uses her Bodyguard feat and then uses her guard’s protection ability to take half of the damage if the attack is successful.

Morale The vesk enjoy combat and fight to the death to protect their boss, unless ordered to stand down.

Event 4: A Private Party
During Combat The vesk step onto the balcony with their rifles drawn and order the PCs to “step away from Ms. Kavetsaka.” If the PCs don’t comply, both guards open fire, shouting for the verthani singer to get behind them. They then try to protect Alyxi as best they can.

Morale The guards believe they are protecting Neva Kavetsaka and fight to the death to keep her safe. If the PCs spend a standard action to attempt a Diplomacy check to change the guards’ attitudes or call out Alyxi’s disguise, each vesk receives a +2 bonus to her Will saving throw and a +10 bonus to her Perception check to pierce the impostor’s disguise. If the vesk realize Alyxi isn’t actually the singer, they help the PCs apprehend her

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Lashunta Ringwear II, Tactical Doshko, Tunderstrike Sonice Rifle with 1 High-Capacity Battery (40 Charges)

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWJHLtvYotSxR7v71Tt_description
attribs.current: Vesk can attack with a special unarmed strike that deals lethal damage, doesn’t count as archaic, and threatens squares. Vesk gain a special version of the Weapon Specialization feat with this unarmed strike at 3rd level, allowing them to add 1–1/2 × their character level to their damage rolls for this unarmed strike (instead of just adding their character level, as usual).

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWJH6anxa6Fo49dfm66_description
attribs.current: Vesk can attack with a special unarmed strike that deals lethal damage, doesn’t count as archaic, and threatens squares. Vesk gain a special version of the Weapon Specialization feat with this unarmed strike at 3rd level, allowing them to add 1–1/2 × their character level to their damage rolls for this unarmed strike (instead of just adding their character level, as usual).

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWJH1Fq2WJZbXS6zs-I_description
attribs.current: The traditional weapon of the vesk, the doshko is composed of one to four triangular blades arranged in a row and attached to a long haft. Ideal for devastating overhand blows and catching and parrying enemy weapons, its use is a highly respected art form in traditional vesk society, but it also sees use by creatures of other races as a variant axe. Traditionally, doshkos are made of steel, but in recent decades they have been crafted using advanced metallurgic techniques and even quantum technology to improve the stabbing edges.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWJHCSGhq16WTtTnWMX_description
attribs.current: A sonic rifle fires a blast that is loud enough to deafen targets in addition to damaging them. Sonic rifles have snub-nosed barrels and typically incorporate U-shaped prongs to improve beam stability.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWJHJBvLaJ3g1-WVdXW_description
attribs.current: The guard fighting style focuses on defence. The Vesk Guard becomes adept at wearing armour, protecting against attacks, and enduring damage and other setbacks from attacks that get through her defences.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat When the vesk guards arrive on the scene, Alyxi draws her ultrathin switchblade from her quickdraw hideaway limb and makes a triple attack against the PC closest to her. She uses trick attack in subsequent rounds while getting closer to the vesk.

Morale If reduced to 30 HP or fewer, Alyxi moves to the edge of the balcony to climb down the side of the building onto another balcony to escape.

attribs.name: other_abilities
attribs.current: Operative Exploits (Master of Disguise [3/Day, 100 Min. or 10 Min., DC 19]), Specialization (Spy))

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Gold AbadarCorp Travel Suit, Called Elite Semi-Auto Pistol with 30 Small Arm Rounds, Ultrathin Switchblade, Mk 3 Serums of Healing (2), Ring of Whispers, Formal Clothing, Credstick (400 Credits); Augmentations: Quickdraw Hideaway Limb (Arm)

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWJKCTqccGIofRB-jB8_description
attribs.current: This blade looks much like a single-edged survival knife when opened, but the blade can be folded or collapsed to fit within the grip, making it easier to conceal. A switch on the knife means the blade can be folded or extended as a swift action, or as part of making an attack or full attack. Most weapon manufacturers that offer daggers also produce switchblades, which are made in the same models.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWJKIUmLZZWZ2-YOnqP_description
attribs.current:
The semiautomatic mechanism of this pistol discharges spent cartridges and reloads fresh ones in the barrel, provided a cartridge remains in the magazine.

Called
A weapon with the called fusion can be teleported to its owner’s hand as a swift action, even if the weapon is in the possession of another creature. This ability has a maximum range of 100 feet, and effects that block teleportation prevent the return of a called weapon. A weapon with the called fusion must be in your possession for at least 24 hours for this ability to function.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWJKPnnN64NciofEZgm_description
attribs.current: When Alyxi succeeds at both the skill check and attack roll of her trick attack, she can make the target flat-footed or off-target until the beginning of her next turn. She might learn exploits that grant you additional options for her debilitating trick, but she can select only one option each time she hits with a trick attack.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWJKT7XP8hLgkpJ3y8w_description
attribs.current: Alyxi can trick or startle a foe and then attack when she drops her guard. As a full action, she can move up to her speed. Whether or not she moved, she can then make an attack with a melee weapon with the operative special property or with any small arm. Just before making her attack, attempt a Bluff, Intimidate, or Stealth check (or a check associated with her specialization; see page 94) with a DC equal to 20 + her target’s CR. If she succeeds at the check, she deals 5d8 additional damage and the target is flat-footed against her attack. She can’t use this ability with a weapon that has the unwieldy special property or that requires a full action to make a single attack.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWJKVMnafZyjMfwEtGd_description
attribs.current: When making a full attack using only melee weapons with the operative special property or small arms, Alyxi can make up to three attacks instead of two.

attribs.name: pilot_bonus
attribs.current: @{Drow Soldier of Fortune|whisper_state}&{template:sf_generic} {{name=@{character_name}}} {{characterid=@{character_id}}} {{title=^{pilot}}} {{r1=[[1d20+@{|piloting_ranks}[RNK]+[[({0,@{|piloting_ranks}}>1) * @{|piloting_class_skill}]][CS]+@{|piloting_ability}[ABI]+2-2@{|piloting_misc}@{Drow Soldier of Fortune|engines_status}@{Drow Soldier of Fortune|power_core_status}@{Drow Soldier of Fortune|computer_query}?{HELM PHASE INITIATIVE|NO, |YES,&{tracker}}]]}} {{r1name=}}

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
Before Combat The drow attempt to sneak up on their targets.
During Combat The drow wait for Avigdis to take her first shot, then try to distract the PCs from Avigdis’s position by throwing grenades and charging into melee combat.

Morale The drow are conditioned to obey orders, and they fight to the death for Avigdis.

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Golemforged Plating III, LFD Pulse Gauntlet with 2 Batteries (20 Charges each), Thunderstrike Streetsweeper with 2 High-Capacity Battery (40 Charges), Mk 2 Incendiary Grenades (2), Credstick (300 Credits)

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWJMf5fworGTOl8xQrc_description
attribs.current:
When a pulse gauntlet strikes its target, it releases a surge of sonic energy that can knock the target down. Pulse gauntlets are made of heavy-duty nylon with reinforced pads over the items’ knuckles.

Sonic Weapons
Sonic weapons emit sonar waves at frequencies that are designed to injure or incapacitate enemies. Many of them are termed “low-frequency devices” (LFDs) and “high-frequency devices” (HFDs) based on the frequencies at which they operate and damage foes.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWJMnPE5EtBmOJjGOyH_description
attribs.current:
Streetsweepers are sonic weapons designed to deliver a low-intensity “punch” of sound. A streetsweeper can be overcharged to deliver a significant sonic blast that can knock down its target.

Sonic Weapons
Sonic weapons emit sonar waves at frequencies that are designed to injure or incapacitate enemies. Many of them are termed “low-frequency devices” (LFDs) and “high-frequency devices” (HFDs) based on the frequencies at which they operate and damage foes.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWJMt3rYUhvXjupsAMm_description
attribs.current: Incendiary grenades detonate in a spray of superheated plasma.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWJNESRRS3hrEy2Di3J_description
attribs.current:
The drow creates up to four lights that resemble small headlights or flashlights. The dancing lights must stay within a 10-foot-radius area in relation to each other but otherwise move as they desire: forward or back, up or down, straight or turning corners, or the like. The lights can move up to 100 feet per round. A light winks out if the distance between you and it exceeds the spell’s range.

They can have only one dancing lights spell active at a time. If they cast this spell while another casting is still in effect, the previous casting is dispelled.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWJNGOw8yuQfRXFL4Rr_description
attribs.current: The drow detects all magic spells, effects, items, and objects (including those on or affecting creatures they can see), as well as hybrid items, in the area. They can’t detect magical traps in this way, as they are created with additional magic that wards them from this common spell. Each round they concentrate on the same area, they can determine if one magic source you detect is from a spell, magic item, or other effect, and the caster level (or item level) of the effect. They can’t determine if there are magic sources in areas they can’t see, or if there was a magic source in an area at one time but that has since expired.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWJN5uL3hCEbXaEyLJl_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, the Drow Soldier of Fortune can make a charge without the charge penalties (see page 248), and he can substitute a bull rush for the melee attack at the end of the charge.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWJN7GSoxhZJJdtoQnT_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, the drow can create a 20-foot-radius area of darkness centred on itself, which negates the effects of all nonmagical light sources in that area. This darkness lasts for a number of minutes equal to the creature’s CR, and the creature can dismiss the effect as a standard action. The darkness doesn’t move with the creature. Unless otherwise noted, any magic source of light can increase the light level in the area as normal.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWJN8x5l38qF3U5m9Xo_description
attribs.current: The blitz fighting style is all about using speed and aggression to get into the thick of melee. The Drow Soldier of Fortune increases their speed and responsiveness, gain abilities that make them better at melee combat than their enemies, and keep on fighting even when surrounded by foes.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
Before Combat Avigdis sets herself up in a tactical sniping position. She then activates her cloaking field ability to gain a bonus to Stealth checks made against the PCs.

During Combat Avigdis takes advantage of her hidden position to snipe the PCs from a distance while her drow allies keep them busy. If the PCs reach her position, Avigdis switches to her laser pistol and uses trick attack. If cornered, Avigdis throws a flash grenade and uses her spell strike ability while attacking with her knife.

Morale Avigdis casts greater invisibility on herself and flees when reduced to 20 Hit Points or fewer.

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: D-Suit III, Advanced Shirren-Eye Rifle with 20 Sniper Rounds, Aphelion Laser Pistol with 2 High-Capacity Batteries (40 Charges each), Mk 2 Flash Grenades (2), Tactical Knife, Credstick (1,200 Credits)

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWKOxDwmHJYzcpHo0nv_description
attribs.current: Once per day as a swift action, a svartalfar can imbue one of its weapons with the bane weapon fusion. It must select one creature type (and subtype, if choosing humanoid or outsider) when it uses this ability. This lasts for 1 hour. This ability functions only while the svartalfar wields the weapon.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWKP-tF3ajku6zCZJJi_description
attribs.current: As a swift action after hitting with a melee weapon, a svartalfar can cast and deliver its entropic grasp spell-like ability to affect the target’s armour, if it hasn’t already cast it yet that day. If the spell is cast in this way, its duration is an additional 6 rounds.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWKOZtOyts4T4lJyDwQ_description
attribs.current: These light blades can be used for both mundane tasks and combat. Tactical knives have large, double-edged blades, often with a section of serrated blade near the haft, and they come in both fixed- and folding-blade designs; users may prefer one style or the other, but the two are identical in terms of price, weight, and damage dealt.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWKOe3d-QJ2g56M1Bii_description
attribs.current: Shirren-eye rifles are named for their compound sights, which resemble the eyes of the insectile race, but are rarely manufactured by shirren companies. Shirren-eye rifles are extremely accurate and favoured by snipers and sharpshooters.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWKOia4u0G75uGHE2WR_description
attribs.current: The laser pistol is possibly the most common small arm used by explorers, guards, mercenaries, and traders. Laser pistols are light and reliable, yet they still deal a respectable amount of damage.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWKOnqzuVNe9zQxkO3l_description
attribs.current:
When detonated, a flash grenade releases a pulse of intense radiance.

Explode (Blinded 1d4 Rounds; 10 ft.)
Explosives have the Explode special property, which lists the amount of damage the explosion deals, the damage type, special effects (with a duration, if necessary), and the radius of the explosion. When a svartalfar Attacks with this type of weapon or Ammunition, aim at a grid intersection. Each Creature within the blast radius takes the listed damage but can attempt a Reflex saving throw for half damage. If the svartalfar scores a critical hit, it applies only to the Creature closest to the targeted intersection (they choose the Creature if several are equally close). If the Explode special property has any special effects other than damage, they are negated with a successful saving throw. Some exploding Weapons, such as smoke Grenades, don't deal damage, so they don't include the damage and damage type entries.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWKP9N7NyDg4nd-lQb5_target
attribs.current: One Nonmagical Manufactured Object or One Manufactured Creatured Touched Each Round

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWKP9N7NyDg4nd-lQb5_description
attribs.current:
Any unattended, manufactured (built from component parts, including metal, wood, plastic, glass, and so on) item the svartalfar touches crumbles into dust, rust, and decay. If the item is so large that it can’t fit within a 3-foot radius, a 3-foot-radius volume of the material is destroyed. This is an instantaneous effect.

They can employ entropic grasp in combat by making a melee attack against their opponent’s EAC. If they hit, they instantaneously reduce a manufactured armour’s KAC and EAC bonus by 3 (to a minimum of a +0 bonus). Damaged armour can be repaired using the Engineering skill; with a successful check, the armour’s armour bonuses are restored to their original values. Against a manufactured creature (generally constructs, but not undead), this attack instead deals [[6d12]] damage.

Weapons and equipment in use by an opponent are more difficult to affect with this spell. They attempt a sunder combat manoeuvre against the item. If successful, they deal [[6d6]] damage to the weapon or item.

Used in combat, this spell lasts 1 round per level, and they can make one melee attack each round on future rounds as a standard action. The target can attempt a save to negate each melee attack, but success does not end the spell.

Casting this spell doesn’t provoke attacks of opportunity.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWKPFUMMR3Qajv92Slw_description
attribs.current: This spell functions like invisibility, except it doesn’t end if the target attacks.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWKOyMpDD23uLnaKGoF_description
attribs.current: When the svartalfar succeeds at both the skill check and attack roll of their trick attack, they can make the target flat-footed or off-target until the beginning of their next turn. They might learn exploits that grant them additional options for their debilitating trick, but they can select only one option each time they hit with a trick attack.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWKP1bCzVD1ORZgTFhr_description
attribs.current: The svaltalfar can trick or startle a foe and then attack when she drops her guard. As a full action, they can move up to their speed. Whether or not they moved, they can then make an attack with a melee weapon with the operative special property or with any small arm. Just before making their attack, attempt a Bluff, Intimidate, or Stealth check (or a check associated with your specialization; see page 94) with a DC equal to 20 + their target’s CR. If they succeed at the check, they deal 5d8 additional damage and the target is flat-footed against their attack. They can’t use this ability with a weapon that has the unwieldy special property or that requires a full action to make a single attack.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWKP5E3GumxFGDwU65L_description
attribs.current: When making a full attack using only melee weapons with the operative special property or small arms, the svartalfar can make up to three attacks instead of two.

attribs.name: captain
attribs.current: Bluff +16 (8 ranks), Computers +13 (8 ranks), Diplomacy +16 (8 ranks), Engineering +13 (8 ranks), Intimidate +16 (8 ranks)

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWKYcuWX6CLLrJZkrwL_description
attribs.current:
Speed 14

Limited Fire
A weapon with this special property can fire only the listed number of times in a starship combat encounter before it requires a brief period of time (10 minutes outside of starship combat) to recharge and rebuild the weapon’s inherent ammunition. A weapon with this special property is often a tracking weapon.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWKYlJ2tq7q6GwErKZ2_description
attribs.current:
EMP

A weapon with this special property emits a beam of electromagnetic energy that does not deal damage to ships or shields, but plays havoc with a ship’s electronic systems. On a hit, an EMP weapon scrambles one of the target starship’s systems, determined randomly. This causes that system to act as if it had the glitching condition for [[1d4]] rounds. If the system is already damaged, instead increase its critical damage by one level of severity for [[1d4]] rounds. Whenever an EMP weapon scores critical damage, it scrambles two systems at random. Systems damaged by EMP weapons can be patched or repaired as normal. Functioning shields are unaffected by EMP weapons and completely block an EMP weapon’s effects.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWKYnwfTDBtc8s8cDeO_description
attribs.current:
Ripper

Firing a blast of metal shards, a weapon with this special property deals terrific damage to a ship’s hull but is almost entirely negated by functioning shields. Halve all damage dealt by ripper weapons to shields. Ripper weapons are always short range.

attribs.name: repeating_system_-MWKZGfcl6E9GVeotUON_description
attribs.current: Common crew quarters are the most basic type. They consist of simple bunks (sometimes folding out from the side of a hallway) or other similarly austere places to rest. Crew members who sleep in common quarters usually keep their personal possessions in a footlocker. Common crew quarters also include a communal bathroom (which includes a military-style shower) and a tiny galley (big enough to prepare only the most basic of meals). Starships with crews numbering in the dozens or hundreds often have massive barracks where crew members sleep in shifts.

attribs.name: repeating_system_-MWKZNrxtlZA1gGZExCy_description
attribs.current: By increasing the security of the starship’s computer, these systems increase the DC to hack into it by 1 (see page 139). This upgrade can be purchased up to four times.

attribs.name: repeating_system_-MWKZUe3OS9Ym9-3lIie_description
attribs.current: Used most often as a last resort, a self-destruct system completely destroys the starship on which it is installed (as if the ship had taken damage equal to twice its Hull Points), often killing everyone on board. A starship in a hex adjacent to a starship that self-destructs takes an amount of damage equal to half the destroyed starship’s maximum Hull Points; this damage can be mitigated by shields. A self-destruct system can be activated only by creatures on the starship (by turning a set of keys, typing in a specific passcode, or other physical means known only to high-ranking members of the crew) and can’t be activated remotely via hacking. The activating creatures set a time delay for the destruction (at least 1 round of starship combat).

attribs.name: repeating_system_-MWKZXRrFxgrwcBxSLiC_description
attribs.current: Unconverted expansion bays count as cargo holds. A cargo hold can contain approximately 25 tons of goods, with no item being larger than Large. A starship with multiple cargo holds can hold larger objects; usually 4 contiguous cargo holds are required to hold Huge objects and 8 for Gargantuan objects.

attribs.name: repeating_system_-MWKZYMeoLLns3rgs4FL_description
attribs.current: Unconverted expansion bays count as cargo holds. A cargo hold can contain approximately 25 tons of goods, with no item being larger than Large. A starship with multiple cargo holds can hold larger objects; usually 4 contiguous cargo holds are required to hold Huge objects and 8 for Gargantuan objects.

attribs.name: repeating_system_-MWKZZVE3vcsX-I5e8uH_description
attribs.current: Escape pods give the crew of a severely damaged or destroyed starship a way to avoid imminent death. An escape pod fits one Medium or smaller creature and has enough supplies and life-support capacity for that creature to survive for 7 days. It is also fitted with a distress beacon that is easily identified by long-range scanners. An escape pod has heat shields that allow it to crash-land on a planet with an atmosphere, but no means of propulsion. A single expansion bay can be converted into six escape pods.

attribs.name: repeating_system_-MWKZZZ8Nkyx2PXpvFsT_description
attribs.current: An expansion bay can be converted into rows of seating for passengers at no cost. A single expansion bay can hold seating for 16 Medium passengers (though seats can be built for larger creatures). This upgrade is appropriate only for taking many passengers on short trips; starships on journeys lasting multiple days should instead have guest quarters installed.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
Before Combat When it notices the PCs’ vessel landing, the sexton creates darkness to conceal itself.

During Combat The sexton steps from the darkness to affect the PCs with its unnerving gaze and then shoots its shadow spines at them. It then enters melee combat and attacks with its chains.
Morale The zealous velstrac revels in both inflicting and receiving pain and fights until destroyed.

attribs.name: reach
attribs.current: 5 ft. (10 ft. with Penitent Shadow Chains)

attribs.name: organization
attribs.current: Solitary, Pair, Escort (1d4 plus 1 Velstrac of Lower CR), or Entourage (2d6 plus 1 Velstrac of Higher CR)

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWKVdstc2XoHsmiIAYm_description
attribs.current: A sexton is addicted to pain. If it doesn’t take damage every 4 hours, it gains the sickened and fatigued conditions until the next time it takes damage.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWKVsLdb2hbQxWDnYsr_description
attribs.current: As a ranged attack, a sexton can fire the spines of solidified shadowstuff that protrude from its back at its foes. This attack has a range increment of 40 feet and a maximum range of 200 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWKVGEQZSIA6OKi7wWT_description
attribs.current: A creature that views a sexton’s visage is beset by visions of torment. A creature that fails a DC 18 Will saving throw against this gaze is panicked by [[1d4]] rounds as horrifying images and sounds flood its mind. This is a mind-affecting fear effect. Whether a creature succeeds at the save or not, it can’t be affected by the panicking effect of a sexton’s unnerving gaze for 24 hours. However, every round after the first that a creature is within range of a sexton’s gaze, it is racked by phantom pains and must succeed at a DC 18 Fortitude save or be nauseated for 1 round. This is a mind-affecting pain effect.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWKVGEQZSIA6OKi7wWT_target
attribs.current: Any Creature That Views the Sexton

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWKVEqG05b2mL1U6Lx9_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, the sexton can create a 20-foot-radius area of darkness centred on itself, which negates the effects of all nonmagical light sources in that area. This darkness lasts for a number of minutes equal to the sexton’s CR (11), and the sexton can dismiss the effect as a standard action. The darkness doesn’t move with the sexton. Unless otherwise noted, any magic source of light can increase the light level in the area as normal.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWKUvWykYr4iorfTQKf_description
attribs.current: Worshipers of Zon-Kuthon developed the first shadow chains using cutting-edge heat-transfer technology, but outsiders rapidly reverse-engineered the weapons, constructing functional facsimiles from their own tech. Shadow chains’ links rapidly absorb heat, while their heavily insulated handle protect their wielders from direct exposure to the freezing darkness. Many adherents of the Midnight Lord make use of the follower, acolyte, and penitent shadow chains, while only the most devout can afford the more powerful ecclesiastic and devotional shadow chains.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWKV1lKY5gyH98GaiLc_description
attribs.current: As a ranged attack, a sexton can fire the spines of solidified shadowstuff that protrude from its back at its foes. This attack has a range increment of 40 feet and a maximum range of 200 feet.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The twisted technicians rush the PCs and gleefully attack with their grafted surgical blades, using their Step Up feat to get closer to retreating PCs and attacking with Step Up and Strike when possible. The technicians take perverse pleasure in being harmed by the PCs.

Morale The twisted technicians fight to the death, basking in the pleasure of pain.

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Professional Clothing, White Eclipse Key Card; Augmentations Standard Darkvision Capacitors

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWJbIZFnxrKN7Uxw8Z0_description
attribs.current: Slightly longer than a survival knife, a hook knife features a wicked barb along the blade’s back edge and deals vicious wounds to enemies when wielded effectively. The drow invented the hook knife, but the weapon is a favourite among cruel mercenaries and other unsavoury types.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The shadow-touched guards prefer to fight in melee range with their hook knives.

Morale The shadow-touched guards fight to the death, finding pleasure in the pain inflicted upon them.

attribs.name: other_abilities
attribs.current: Shadow Manifestations (Eerie Perception, Insubstantiality, Shadow Cloak)

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Advanced Iridishell, Gelid Ice Carbine with 1 High-Capacity Battery (40 Charges), Hook Knife, Grey Eclipse Key Card

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWJbap20alZt3p3m3Fg_description
attribs.current: Rather than relying on coolant to produce supercooled gas, an ice carbine pumps heat out of large vents integrated in the weapon’s stock and uses the temperature change to produce brittle, razor-sharp shards of ice in the chamber. This design allows it to either fire a short, targeted shot or spray a hailstorm of piercing needles at a group of foes. The heat-exchange technology used in these weapons is common on Verces, where it’s used for many purposes, making it relatively easy to find them in the Pact Worlds, from the subzero models (often built in illicit basement labs) to absolute-zero ice carbines, which are the best in the Pact Worlds. Gelid and ultracold ice carbines improve on the subzero version’s technology and overall power.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NAeDb3hIAyrqWSlMwKs_description
attribs.current:
Your corporeal form can flicker into insubstantial shadow.

Prerequisites: Two other manifestations.

Gift: You have a 20% chance to treat a critical hit as a normal hit, allowing you to ignore the critical hit’s extra damage and critical hit effect. If the attack affects incorporeal creatures normally, such as a weapon with the ghost killer fusion, you can’t ignore it in this way.

Stain: If an ally targets you with a beneficial spell that has a range of touch, you have a 20% chance to gain no benefit from it. The spell is still cast and expended.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The creeping shades use Spring Attack to move about the room and into various solid objects, making it difficult for the PCs to attack them.

Morale The creeping shades feed on the PCs’ life forces until destroyed, but do not pursue the PCs out of the room.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWKEZdEuNctlAaLvI3T_description
attribs.current: A creature affected by a creeping shade’s inhabit ability risks being poisoned by gloom spores when the creeping shade leaves its body. For every round past the first that a creeping shade has inhabited a creature’s body, the creature takes a cumulative –1 penalty to the saving throw to resist the poison.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWKEdTMgEhQ1Sfewm9n_description
attribs.current: When a creeping shade scores a critical hit on a living creature, it enters that creature’s space (this doesn’t provoke an attack of opportunity) and merges with the creature’s body for 1d6+1 rounds. The creeping shade doesn’t control the creature it inhabits, but does make the creature feel an overwhelming sense of melancholy. An inhabited creature can’t benefit from morale bonuses. Every round after the first, an inhabited creature can attempt a DC 18 Fortitude save to eject the creeping shade from its body. In addition, a creeping shade can inhabit an adjacent, unconscious living creature as a full action if that creature fails a DC 18 Fortitude save. When a creeping shade leaves an inhabited creature’s body (either if it is ejected or if the duration of the ability ends), it appears in an adjacent square of its choosing and regains [[5d8]] Hit Points, and the affected creature is subjected to gloom spores.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWKEdTMgEhQ1Sfewm9n_effect
attribs.current: Target feels a sense of melancholy and cannot benefit from morale bonuses.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat Each shadow mastiff uses its bay ability and then attempts to flank the PCs.

Morale The shadow mastiffs fight to the death.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWKM1NuZvRRRP0GjIwh_description
attribs.current: When a shadow mastiff howls or barks, every creature within a 300-foot spread except evil outsiders must succeed at a DC 15 Will save or become panicked for [[1d4]] rounds. This is a sense-dependent, mind-affecting fear effect. Whether a creature succeeds at the save or not, it can’t be affect by the same shadow mastiff’s bay for 24 hours.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWKMING0hcMBXkZZFAD_description
attribs.current: In any condition of illumination other than bright light, a shadow mastiff disappears into the shadows, giving it concealment (50% miss chance). A shadow mastiff can suspend or resume this ability as a swift action. In addition, a shadow mastiff gains a +4 racial bonus to Stealth checks while in any condition of illumination other than bright light, and it can hide even if it is observed or lacks cover.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWKN-AUEMQXqJX2Zesc_description
attribs.current: In addition to dealing the listed damage, if a shadow mastiff hits with its bite attack and the attack roll result equals or exceeds the target’s KAC + 4, the shadow mastiff also automatically trips the foe (this takes no action).

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
During Combat The umbral disciples enter melee range and channel negative energy to harm the PCs. They attempt to keep the PCs from attacking Kaeon Rhyse, using their Stand Still feat to halt any movement toward the executive if possible.

Morale The umbral disciples rejoice in the pain of battle, fighting to the death to protect Dr Gragant’s chosen representative on the Material Plane.

attribs.name: other_abilities
attribs.current: Easily Augmented, Shadow Manifestations (Coldblooded, Eerie Perception, Pain Refuge), Skin Mimic

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Lashunta Ringwear III, Wrack Devastation Blade; Augmentations: Mk 2 Dermal Plating

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWK4VLYOdMAJ51ePZw7_description
attribs.current: Three times per day as a full action, an umbral disciple can channel negative energy in a 30-foot-radius burst, dealing 4d8 negative energy damage to all living creatures. A successful DC 16 Will saving throw halves this damage.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWK4PpgS87Is40g0F6X_description
attribs.current: The overlarge devastation blade is a two-edged sword that creates terrifying wounds. Devastation blades are rarely subtle weapons, due to both their size and their often elaborate spiked designs.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NAeDzlpZpOZhrZFlGn3_description
attribs.current:
The lines between pleasure and pain are blurred for you.

Gift: The first time you take Hit Point damage in a given combat, for 1 round you can roll attack rolls, saving throws, and skill checks twice and take the better result. You can do so again the first time you drop below half your Hit Points in a given combat. During this time, however, you can’t benefit from morale bonuses.

Stain: Increase any damage you take by an amount equal to the number of manifestations you have, up to a maximum of double the original amount of damage.

attribs.name: tactics
attribs.current:
Before Combat Kaeon has been observing the PCs’ actions through his surveillance equipment, and when he knows they are close, he casts lesser resistant armour, choosing two energy types used by the PCs. He then casts haste and mirror image.

During Combat Kaeon uses his spell grenade magic hack to imbue a grenade with overload systems. He positions himself out of the PCs’ reach while his bodyguards engage them. If Kaeon Rhyse sustains significant damage from a single attack, he activates his void heart manifestation as a reaction to transfer half of the damage to one of his bodyguards (who doesn’t resist). If reduced to 60 Hit Points or fewer, Kaeon uses shadow jaunt to get to a position where he can use a mk 3 healing serum.

Morale Kaeon’s sole purpose is to follow Dr Gragant’s orders, and he fights to the death to prevent the PCs from ruining her plans.

attribs.name: other_abilities
attribs.current: Cache Capcitor 1 (Keen Senses), Easily Augmented, Magic Hacks (Spell Grenade, Tech Countermeasures), Shadow Manifestations (Eerie Perception, Insubstantiality, Shadow Jaunt, Void Heart), Skin Mimic, Spell Cache (Accelerated Datajack)

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: White Carbon Carbon Skin (White Force Field), Elite Semi-Auto Pistol with 30 Small Arm Rounds, Ultrathin Switchblade, Mk 2 Cryo Grenades (2), Mk 3 Serums of Healing (2); Augmentations: Accelerated Datajack, Storage Prosthetic Limb (Arm)

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWK5lndGCyAhU4s3z2u_description
attribs.current: This blade looks much like a single-edged survival knife when opened, but the blade can be folded or collapsed to fit within the grip, making it easier to conceal. A switch on the knife means the blade can be folded or extended as a swift action, or as part of making an attack or full attack. Most weapon manufacturers that offer daggers also produce switchblades.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWK5tMUI0pGkSAXejzZ_description
attribs.current: The semiautomatic mechanism of this pistol discharges spent cartridges and reloads fresh ones in the barrel, provided a cartridge remains in the magazine.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWK6-MJDZnz4FueM5gV_description
attribs.current:
Cryo grenades release a blast of supercooled chemicals on impact, which immediately coalesce into freezing particles.

Explode (2d8 C, Staggered 1 Round, 15 ft.)
Explosives have the Explode special property, which lists the amount of damage the explosion deals, the damage type, special effects (with a duration, if necessary), and the radius of the explosion. When Kaeon Attacks with this type of weapon or Ammunition, aim at a grid intersection. Each Creature within the blast radius takes the listed damage but can attempt a Reflex saving throw for half damage. If Kaeon scores a critical hit, it applies only to the Creature closest to the targeted intersection (he chooses the Creature if several are equally close). If the Explode special property has any special effects other than damage, they are negated with a successful saving throw. Some exploding Weapons, such as smoke Grenades, don't deal damage, so they don't include the damage and damage type entries.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MWK6Ht3EhyyPsQbYdjC_description
attribs.current:
By touching the target (usually requiring a melee attack roll against the target’s EAC, but Kaeon can add his key ability score modifier instead of his Strength modifier if it is higher), Kaeon floods the target’s body with random jolts of electricity or other interference. On a failed Fortitude save, the target is overwhelmed and potentially unable to perform tasks as normal. While this spell is in effect, whenever the target takes any action or reaction, there is a 50% chance that the target simply takes no action instead. Roll this chance separately for each action the target would take. For example, if the target wishes to move and attack during its turn, it would roll d% twice to determine whether it could take those actions—once before each action it wishes to take. Each attack of a full attack action counts as separate action.

This spell is effective against living and unliving creatures, and casting it doesn’t provoke attacks of opportunity.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MWK6M1iWZaI8EkH8Bsr_description
attribs.current:
Like rewriting the code that makes up a computer program, Kaeon manipulates the target’s DNA to painfully rewire that target’s biological functions to mimic the cold and rigid processes of a robot. The target must succeed at a Will saving throw, or all of its movement speeds are halved and it takes 3d6 slashing damage per round on its turn as its internal organs shift and transform to become more like the inner components of a robot. Each round, the target can attempt a Fortitude saving throw to halve the damage this spell causes.

While this spell is in effect, the target’s body becomes visibly more robotic; its voice is tinny and halting, its movements are jerky, and its face is unmoving and emotionless. The target has the flat-footed condition, and it takes a –2 penalty to all Sense Motive checks as well as to all Charisma-based and Dexterity-based skill and ability checks.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MWK6M1iWZaI8EkH8Bsr_save_effect
attribs.current: Will Negates and Fortitude for Half Damage.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MWK6M1iWZaI8EkH8Bsr_effect
attribs.current: All movements are halved and target takes [[3d6]] slashing damage per round as well as taking -2 penalty to Sense Motive, Charisma-based, and Dexterity-based skill and ability checks.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MWK6SvIo4HZnE0glkIT_description
attribs.current: Kaeon causes an electrical device in his possession to surge in power and unleash a line of electricity from the massive oversurge. This deals 10d6 electricity damage to all creatures and objects in the area.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MWK6Vy1BEJ4FB1lcIfl_description
attribs.current: Kaeon can dissipate the charges from one technological object, temporarily depower one electrically powered technological object that does not use charges, or severely hinder a construct with the technological subtype. If the spell targets an object with charges, the object loses all of its remaining charges. If the object is powered by electrical means other than charges, its functions are suppressed for [[1d4]] rounds. If the spell targets a creature not of the technological subtype, it affects a random charged or electrically powered item in that creature’s possession. If the target is a construct with the technological subtype, it is staggered and cannot use any energy-based attacks for [[1d4]] rounds. A construct with the technological subtype that is affected by this spell can attempt a Fortitude saving throw at the end of each round to shrug off the effect.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MWK6Vy1BEJ4FB1lcIfl_effect
attribs.current: Object with charges loses all remaining charges and its functions suppressed for [[1d4]] rounds, creatures of the technological subtype are staggered and cannot use energy-based attacks for [[1d4]] rounds.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MWK6ZA9t4YvbeBVaRBa_target
attribs.current: Up to Ten Creatures, No Two of Which Can Be More than 30 ft. Apart

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MWK6ZA9t4YvbeBVaRBa_description
attribs.current:
The targeted creatures move and act more quickly than normal. This extra speed has several effects.

When making a full attack, a hasted creature can also take a separate move action in order to move. The movement can occur before, after, or between the attacks from the full attack. All movement must occur at the same time.

All of the hasted creature’s modes of movement (including base, burrow, climb, fly, and swim speeds) increase by 30 feet, to a maximum of twice the target’s normal speed using that form of movement. This increase counts as an enhancement bonus, and it affects the creature’s jumping distance as normal for increased speed. Multiple haste effects don’t stack. Haste counters and negates slow.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MWK6cDhIyVTmcplgwy8_description
attribs.current: Lesser resistant armour grants the target (and its gear) protection from Kaeon's choice of either kinetic damage or energy damage. If he chooses kinetic damage, the target and their gear gain DR 5/— that protects against bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage. If he chooses energy damage, pick any two of acid, cold, electricity, fire, and sonic damage. The target and their gear gain energy resistance 5 that protects against the chosen types of energy. This damage reduction or energy resistance doesn’t stack with any damage reduction or energy resistance the target already has, and multiple castings of this spell don’t stack.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MWK6hLYVT-utckNbzYj_description
attribs.current:
Kaeon concentrates key particles in his blood into tiny biological nanobots that he can inject into a foe with a touch, disrupting and damaging its natural processes. Make a melee attack against the target’s EAC; if he hits, the nanobots deal 4d8 damage and swarm through the target’s biological or mechanical systems, causing the creature to be confused, as per confusion, for 10 rounds. If the target succeeds at a Fortitude save, it takes only half damage and negates the confusion effect. A confused target can attempt a Will saving throw at the beginning of its turn each round to end the confusion effect.

Casting this spell doesn’t provoke attacks of opportunity.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MWK6hLYVT-utckNbzYj_effect
attribs.current: Target takes full damage and is confused for 10 rounds.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MWK6hLYVT-utckNbzYj_save_effect
attribs.current: Target takes half damage and negates the effects of confusion.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-MWK6kujXnHvxj82VeEx_description
attribs.current:
This spell creates a number of illusory doubles of Kaeon that inhabit his square. These doubles make it difficult for enemies to precisely locate and attack him.

When he casts mirror image, it creates [[1d4]] figment images. These images remain in his space and move with him, mimicking his movements, sounds, and actions exactly. Whenever he is attacked or are the target of a spell that requires an attack roll, there is a possibility that the attack targets one of his images instead. If the attack hits, roll randomly to see whether the selected target is real or a figment. If it is a figment, the figment is destroyed. If the attack misses by 5 or less, one of his figments is destroyed by the near miss, and an attack that misses him due to a miss chance also destroys an image. Area spells and effects that don’t require an attack roll affect him normally and don’t destroy any of his figments. Spells with a range of touch are harmlessly discharged if used to destroy a figment.

An attacker must be able to see the figments to be fooled. If he is invisible or the attacker is blind, the spell has no effect. Blindsense doesn’t help distinguish the figments from the real him, but blindsight is sufficient to do so.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NAeBwT3zZtAwzwz8NA5_description
attribs.current:
Your corporeal form can flicker into insubstantial shadow.

Prerequisites: Two other manifestations.

Gift: You have a 20% chance to treat a critical hit as a normal hit, allowing you to ignore the critical hit’s extra damage and critical hit effect. If the attack affects incorporeal creatures normally, such as a weapon with the ghost killer fusion, you can’t ignore it in this way.

Stain: If an ally targets you with a beneficial spell that has a range of touch, you have a 20% chance to gain no benefit from it. The spell is still cast and expended.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NAeC1rPagYiG4zPvTOD_description
attribs.current:
You can jump from shadow to shadow with little effort.

Prerequisites: One other manifestation.

Gift: As a full action, you can teleport, as if using a dimension door spell, from one area of dim light or darkness to another, transporting only yourself and objects you wear or carry. If you are overburdened, this teleportation fails. Further, you can teleport only up to 60 feet. Once you teleport, you can’t do so again until you take a 10-minute rest during which you could regain Stamina Points. You can use this ability a number of times per day equal to the number of manifestations you have.

Stain: You are apathetic and difficult to stir into action. When you roll your initiative check, roll twice and take the worse result.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-NAeCFdDHr0leOaKHHsU_description
attribs.current:
The darkness in your soul can draw on the life force of allies.

Prerequisites: One other manifestation.

Gift: Once per day when you take ability damage, ability drain, or Hit Point damage, you can divide the damage or drain evenly between you and one ally within 30 feet of you. The ally knows what you’re trying to do and can attempt a Will saving throw to resist the link. This ability takes no action on your part, and you can use it even if it isn’t your turn.

Stain: You struggle to remember the meaning of friendly bonds. You can’t benefit from or use the aid another action.

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Static Arc Pistol with 3 Batteries (20 Charges each)

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWKGVx4XkQdl2rbpQv3_description
attribs.current: As a standard action, an ihonva can lick a grappled or helpless creature to expose it to ihonva infestation.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWKGNL9bQmL3kWddCrh_description
attribs.current: Arc pistols fire deadly, stunning blasts of electricity at ranged targets. They have a two-pronged emitter that directs the electrical blast and a bulky chamber that holds the capacitor.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWKISJK5jxNe10QzZ5D_description
attribs.current: A creature injured by a niaq’s feeding lance or quills is exposed to niaq virus.

attribs.name: pilot_bonus
attribs.current: @{Cuvacaran Police Officer|whisper_state}&{template:sf_generic} {{name=@{character_name}}} {{characterid=@{character_id}}} {{title=^{pilot}}} {{r1=[[1d20+@{|piloting_ranks}[RNK]+[[({0,@{|piloting_ranks}}>1) * @{|piloting_class_skill}]][CS]+@{|piloting_ability}[ABI]+2-2@{|piloting_misc}@{Cuvacaran Police Officer|engines_status}@{Cuvacaran Police Officer|power_core_status}@{Cuvacaran Police Officer|computer_query}?{HELM PHASE INITIATIVE|NO, |YES,&{tracker}}]]}} {{r1name=}}

attribs.name: other_abilities
attribs.current: Operative Exploits (Glimpse the Truth, Uncanny Mobility, Uncanny Pilot), Skin Mimic, Specialization (Detective)

attribs.name: gear
attribs.current: Business Stationwear, Frostbite-Class Zero Pistol with 2 Batteries (20 Charges each), Tactical Baton, Flashlight, Laser Microphone, Manacles, Personal Comm Unit, Police Cruiser, Hacking Tool Kit

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWV-zDRZUP8VL3aEKni_description
attribs.current: A baton is a thin, solid metal shaft, usually with a textured rubber grip. A tactical baton can be used to inflict precise bludgeoning blows.

attribs.name: repeating_attack_-MWV02jpaOqwFf0SMCrV_description
attribs.current: Zero pistols have a weighted grip to balance their unusually heavy barrels. A cylindrical canister over the barrel contains and directs the coolants.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWV0CxKxvuBgugo9ID9_description
attribs.current: A Cuvacaran police officer can trick or startle a foe and then attack when she drops her guard. As a full action, they can move up to their speed. Whether or not they moved, they can then make an attack with a melee weapon with the operative special property or with any small arm. Just before making their attack, attempt a Bluff, Intimidate, or Stealth check (or a check associated with their specialization; see page 94) with a DC equal to 20 + their target’s CR. If they succeed at the check, they deal 3d8 additional damage and the target is flat-footed against their attack. They can’t use this ability with a weapon that has the unwieldy special property or that requires a full action to make a single attack.

attribs.name: repeating_ability_-MWV0A9Z-o4gkKOGkX6o_description
attribs.current: When the Cuvacaran police officer succeeds at both the skill check and attack roll of their trick attack, they can make the target flat-footed or off-target until the beginning of their next turn. they might learn exploits that grant them additional options for their debilitating trick, but they can select only one option each time you hit with a trick attack.
